Package com.fdmgroup.spring.timothy_chai_ecommerce_project.controller

Class CartController

java.lang.Object
com.fdmgroup.spring.timothy_chai_ecommerce_project.controller.CartController
@Controller @Transactional(readOnly=false) public class CartController extends Object
This class is the controller responsible for handling all cart-related requests, including adding to the cart, removing from the cart, and checking out
Author:
- timothy.chai

  • Constructor Details

    • CartController

      public CartController()

  • Method Details

    • index

      @RequestMapping("/") public String index()
      This is the index page for the cart. It is simply a redirect to the cart page.
      Returns:
      A redirect to the cart page.

    • addToCart

      @PostMapping("/addToCart") public String addToCart(@SessionAttribute Customer customer, int productID, @RequestParam int quantity)
      This method is called when the user clicks on the 'Add to Cart' button located either under each product display, or from the 'likes' list This method is used to add an item to the cart. It retrieves the customer information from the session, adds the item to the cart, updates the cart, and saves the customer information. Then it redirects the user to the product dashboard.
      Parameters:
      customer - the customer instance who made the request
      productId - the product ID of the product to be added
      quantity - the quantity of the product to be added
      Returns:
      link redirect to the product dashboard

    • removeFromCart

      @PostMapping("/removeFromCart") public String removeFromCart(@SessionAttribute Customer customer, @RequestParam int productID, @RequestParam("productQuantity") int quantity)
      This method is called when the user clicks on any of the 'Remove From Cart' buttons located next to each product This method is used to remove an item from the cart. It retrieves the customer information from the session, removes the item from the cart, updates the cart, and saves the customer information. Then it redirects the user to the product dashboard.
      Parameters:
      customer - the customer instance who made the request
      productID - the product ID of the product to be removed
      quantity - the quantity of the item to be removed
      Returns:
      link redirect to the product dashboard

    • updateCartItemQuantity

      @PostMapping("/updateCartItemQuantity") public String updateCartItemQuantity(@SessionAttribute Customer customer, @RequestParam int productID, @RequestParam("updateQuantity") String direction)
      This method is used to update the quantity of an item in the cart. This method is called when a customer presses the +/- buttons on the webpage, indicating to add or remove one unit of product This method confirms if the customer wishes to add or remove one unit of the requested product, then calls the addToCart or removeFromCart methods accordingly
      Parameters:
      customer - the customer information
      productID - the product ID
      direction - the direction of the update, either "plus" or "minus"
      Returns:
      the redirect to the product dashboard
      See Also:
      • addToCart(Customer, int, int)
      • removeFromCart(Customer, int, int)

    • submitOrder

      @PostMapping("/checkout") public String submitOrder(@SessionAttribute Customer customer)
      Process cart checkout for the logged-in customer. Retrieves the customer's details from the session attribute, converts the cart items into an order, clears the cart, and updates the customer and cart information in the database. The new order is then persisted onto the database for future reference.
      Parameters:
      customer - The logged-in customer retrieved from session attribute.
      Returns:
      A redirection to the product dashboard page.
      See Also:
      • OrderService.createOrder(Customer)

    • refresh

      @PostMapping("/refresh") public String refresh(@SessionAttribute Customer customer)
      Handles the POST request for refreshing the customer's cart. This method updates the customer's information and cart in the session and redirects to the product dashboard page.
      Parameters:
      customer - the currently logged-in customer retrieved from session attributes.
      Returns:
      link the redirection to the product dashboard page.
